Nishi Nidamarty wrote:
> 
> include src.jar into classpath and see if it helps

I recommend passing all classes to the JVM's classpath at launch time, 
rather than using magic folders.:

     java -cp blahblah junit.textui.TestRunner YourTestCase

As for what needs to be on the classpath:

1. junit.jar
2. Your tests
3. Your production code (what the tests are testing)
4. Any libraries your production code/test code use

That's it.

Good luck.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
